medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient has experienced seizures for the past 6 years.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Initially, the patient experienced seizures without any discernible trigger in three primary forms. Seizure type 1 includes tightness in the chest, palpitations, and flushing of the cheeks without any loss of awareness, lasting for tens of seconds and occurring several times a day. Seizure type 2 adds impaired responsiveness, blank staring, and loss of awareness, lasting for dozens of seconds to a minute and occurring 5-6 times a year. Seizure type 3 includes head and eye version, tonic and clonic movements, lasting tens of seconds and occurring once a year. The patient has been taking lamotrigine and valproic acid regularly for approximately 5 years, but seizure types 1 and 2 are still not well controlled.
medical_history.family_history: There is no reported family history of epilepsy.
